title: SEMI G73-0997 (Reapproved 1104) TEST METHOD FOR PULL STRENGTH FOR WIRE BONDING - # 4.1  Definitions
content: 4.1.1  hook — L or similar-shaped tool for hooking a wire for pull test.

title: SEMI G73-0997 (Reapproved 1104) TEST METHOD FOR PULL STRENGTH FOR WIRE BONDING - # 5  Apparatus
content:
5.1  Pull Tester or equivalent equipment  
5.1.1  Enough stroke to break a wire.  
5.1.2  Accuracy — Within $\pm \ : 0 . 5 \%$ to the full scale of load cell.  
5.1.3  Pull Speed — Constant speed.  
5.1.4  Hooks — Between 25–100 microns in diameter.  
NOTE 1:  Hook must be made of material strong enough to break wire while testing but not with a small diameter so as to cut through the wire.  
5.1.5  Calibration of equipment must be simple enough so that users can calibrate it easily. Instructions for calibration should be described in equipment manual.

title: SEMI G73-0997 (Reapproved 1104) TEST METHOD FOR PULL STRENGTH FOR WIRE BONDING - # 6  Sampling
content: 6.1  Measure at least 30 points from at least 2 devices. From each side of the devices, select the same number of wires randomly.

title: SEMI G73-0997 (Reapproved 1104) TEST METHOD FOR PULL STRENGTH FOR WIRE BONDING - # 7  Calibration and Standardization
content:
7.1  Calibration Method  
7.1.1  Calibration of equipment should be done using official and traceable weights.  
7.1.2  Display the weight and verify whether the results are within the equipment’s accuracy.  
7.1.3  Repeat the measurement using other weights to verify repeatability and linearity of the calibration.  
7.2  Interval of Calibration  
7.2.1  Calibrate at regular intervals at least once a year.  
7.2.2  Calibration must be able to be done just before testing when necessary or specifically instructed.

title: SEMI G73-0997 (Reapproved 1104) TEST METHOD FOR PULL STRENGTH FOR WIRE BONDING - # 8  Procedure
content:
8.1  Fix samples using a clamper or adhesive, so that the sample will not float, without applying excessive stress to the wire.  
8.2  Set pull speed to $0 . 5 \mathrm { m m / s e c }$ while measuring.  
8.3  Insert the hook under the bonded wire between the top of the first bonding and the center of the loop.  
NOTE 2:  Select hook position accordingly to package, wiring condition, and wire diameter.  
NOTE 3:  Place the hook perpendicular to wiring direction if there is no specific instruction.  
NOTE 4:  Do not measure damaged or deformed wire.  
8.4  Pull the hook perpendicular to die/substrate.  
8.5  Record the force that breaks the wire as the pull strength.  
8.6  Repeat the measurement on another wire.  
NOTE 5:  Do not change the position while testing the same samples.  
5,E: The second bond

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1  Purpose
content: 1.1  The purpose of this document is to standardize the specifications for $3 0 0 ~ \mathrm { \ m m }$ wafer tape frames used between the dicing process and the die-bonding process.

content: 2.1  This standard documents the d imensions, characteristics, and measurement methods for $3 0 0 ~ \mathrm { { m m } }$ wafer tape frames. 2.2  This standard can be used as th e specification sheet for tape frame upon purchasing. 2.3  This standard uses the SI unit system.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 7  Test Methods (Part 1)
content:
Title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 7  Test Methods

Content: 7.1 Dimensions — To be measure d with a measuring device, such as a caliper, with a precision of $0 . 0 5 \mathrm { m m }$ . 7.2 Surface Hardness — To be me asured according to the method in JIS Z2245 with a Rockwell Hardness Tester. 7.3 Resiliency — Secure one side of the frame in a vice, and bend with a force of $3 0 ~ N$ for 60 seconds. After that, release the frame and measure the change from the original shape with a linear scale ruler. The linear scale ruler should have a precision of at least 0.5 mm. 7.4 Surface Roughness — Measur e with a surface roughness gauge. Surface roughness is measured perpendicular to the undulation and must be shown as roughness average $\left( \mathrm { R _ { a } } \right)$ and maximum peak-to-valley roughness height $\left( \mathrm { R } _ { \operatorname* { m a x } } \right)$ . Refer to ISO4287 Part 1, JIS B0601, and ANSI/ASME B46.1. 7.5 Flatness — Place the frame on a surface with near-zero flatness. Measure the lowest point and the highest point on the frame with a height gauge, and record the

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1  Purpose
content:
1.1  This standard describes proced ures for measuring the mechanical, physical, chemical, thermal, and electrical properties of leadframe tape.  
1.2  Equipment, sampling, and pro cedures are referred to in the individual test methods.  
1.3  The test methods for the indivi dual properties have been given in this standard.  
1.3.1  Ionic impurities (see SEMI G7 5.1).  
1.3.2  Adhesive strength (see SEMI G 75.2).  
1.3.3  Peel strength of protective film from leadframe tape (see SEMI G75.3).  
1.3.4  Water absorption (see SEMI G75.4).  
1.3.5  Weight loss (see SEMI G75.5) .  
1.3.6  Shrinkage factor (see SEMI G 75.6).  
1.3.7  Thermal decomposition tempe rature (see SEMI G75.7).  
1.3.8  Coefficient of thermal expansion and glass transition temperature (see SEMI G75.8).  
1.3.9  Tensile strength, elongation, a nd tensile modulus (see SEMI G75.9).  
1.3.10  Volume and surface resistivity (see SEMI G75.10).  
1.3.11  Dielectric constant and dissipa tion factor (see SEMI G75.11).  
1.3.12  Breakdown strength (see SEMI G75.12).  
1.3.13  Leakage current (see SEMI G7 5.13).

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2  Scope
content: 2.1  The methods help tape manufa cturers, leadframe manufacturers, and their customers in evaluating leadframe tapes.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2.2  Units
content: 2.2.1  This standard test method uses SI (metric) units.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 3  Referenced Documents
content: 3.1  Referenced documents are list ed in each test method.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Terminology (Part 1)
content:
Title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Terminology

Content: 4.1 breakdown strength — Under the specified test conditions, the quotient of the minimum r.m.s. voltage at the breakdown of the test piece (breakdown voltage) divided by the distance between the two electrodes (thickness of test piece). 4.2 dielectric constant — The amo unt of electrostatic energy stored in a unit volume of a substance in a unit electric field. It is called dielectric constant (εr) and expressed as the quotient of electrostatic capacity of a parallel condenser employing the test piece as the dielectric $\displaystyle \left( \mathrm { C _ { x } } \right)$ divided by that of the same condenser when air (under the standard condition, the dielectric constant of air can be taken for that of vacuum) is used as the dielectric $\left( \mathrm { C } _ { 0 } \right)$ , measured under a specified frequency. $$ \mathrm { i . e . , } \ \varepsilon = \mathrm { C _ { x } / C _ { o } } $$ 4.3 dielectric dissipation factor — Dielectric dissipation factor is the tangent of the complementary angle of dielectric phase angle (tand). The

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Terminology (Part 2)
content:
Title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Terminology

Content: dielectric phase angle is the phase difference angle (q) between sine-wave voltage applied to the test piece and the current component having the same frequency as the applied voltage caused by the voltage application. 4.4 HAST — Highly accelerated s tress test: For example, $1 2 1 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } / 2 \mathrm { a t m } / 1 0 0 \%$ RH. 4.5 leadframe tape — An adhesiv e coated tape. After removing protective film, laminated to the inner leads, which stops lead shift and/or lead lift during the assembly process. 4.6 protective film —A plastic film to cover the adhesive on leadframe tapes. This film prevents the adhesive from becoming contaminated and is removed from the leadframe tape just prior to taping the leadframe. 4.7 strain — The ratio of elongatio n of the sample length to the original length at the applied stress level. 4.8 stress — The applied force per unit cross-sectional area of the sample. 4.9 surface resistivity — The quot ient of the voltage gradient parallel to the current along the surface of the test piece

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Terminology (Part 3)
content:
Title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Terminology

Content: divided by the current per unit width of the surface. 4.10 tensile break strength — The t ensile force per unit of original cross section of the sample at the point of breakage. 4.11 tensile modulus — The ratio o f stress to strain of the sample below the yield point, in the elastic region of the stress/strain curve. NOTE: Plastic materials may not have a true elastic region in the stress/strain curve or force/elongation curve. A tangent is drawn to the maximum slope of the curve in order to determine the modulus. 4.12 thermal decomposition temperature (base film and adhesive) The thermal decomposition temperature is determined at $5 \%$ of the weight loss when the tape is set to the thermal ramp at $1 0 ^ { \circ }$ C/minute. 4.13 volume resistivity — The quotient of the voltage gradient parallel to the current within the test piece divided by the current density.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.1  Ionic Impurities
content: 5.1.1  Ionic contamination can adver sely affect the reliability of semiconductor devices by causing leakage currents and aluminum corrosion.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.2  Adhesive Strength
content: 5.2.1  Low adhesive strength may re sult in inner leads movement of leadframe during the assembly and packaging process which may result in low yield or poor device reliability.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.3  Peel Strength of Protective Film from Leadframe Tape
content: 5.3.1  If the peeling strength of prote ctive film from leadframe tape varies in peeling strength, the taping machines will not operate consistently.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.4  Water Absorption
content: 5.4.1  If the leadframe tapes absorb a n excessive amount of water in storage, before or after packaging, then reliability of devices made by these leadframes may be affected. Current leakage and corrosion of device metallization may occur.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.5  Weight Loss
content: 5.5.1  Weight loss may indicate that devices manufactured with the leadframe tape may have reliability problems due to the tape outgassing.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.6  Shrinkage Factor
content: 5.6.1  Excessive shrinkage at therma l processing may cause the lead shift and wire bond problems for automatic bonders.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.7  Thermal Decomposition Temp erature
content: 5.7.1  The devices manufactured wit h leadframe tape that decomposes at too low a temperature may have lower reliability.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.8  Coefficient of Thermal Expans ion and Glass Transition Temperature
content:
5.8.1  Excessive expansion of the leadframe tape may cause lead shift and/or lead lift and result in dislocated bonds from automatic bonders.  
5.9  Tensile Strength, Elongation, a nd Tensile Modulus  
5.9.1  If the tensile strength, elongati on, and tensile modulus varies, the taping machines will not operate consistently.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.10  Volume and Surface Resistivity
content: 5.10.1  Low volume and/or surface re sistivity is indicative of potential leakage currents between leadframe inner leads which can affect the function of the device.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.11  Dielectric Constant and Dissip ation Factor
content: 5.11.1  High dielectric constant mater ials used in semiconductor packages may cause transmission delays. High dielectric loss causes energy loss, which leads to exothermic problems in semiconductor packages.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.12  Breakdown Strength
content: 5.12.1  Very low breakdown strength may cause devices to fail in use.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5.13  Leakage Current
content: 5.13.1  A high leakage current betwee n leadframe inner leads, which may be exacerbated due to high moisture test conditions and impurities in the tape, may result in poor device reliability.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1  Summary of Method
content:
1.1  Ionic impurities are extracted f rom sample tape by water at $1 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ or $1 2 1 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and quantitatively analyzed by ion chromatography and flame photometry or atomic absorption spectrometry. The pH and electrical conductivity of the extracted solutions are also measured.  
1.2  If sample tape needs the cure b efore the extraction, vender should inform the customer of the necessity of curing and report the impurity data after cure.  
1.3  Ion chromatography is used to determine the presence and concentration of the following ionic species: $\mathrm { { N a } ^ { + } }$ , $\mathrm { N H } 4 ^ { + }$ , $\mathrm { K } ^ { + }$ , $\mathrm { N O } _ { 3 } \mathrm { \cdot }$ , Cl-, $\mathbf { B r } ^ { - }$ , ${ \mathrm { S O } _ { 4 } } ^ { 2 \cdot }$ -, $\mathrm { P O } _ { 4 } ^ { 3 . }$ -.  
1.4 Flame photometry or atomic a bsorption spectrometry is used to determine the concentration of $\mathrm { { N a } ^ { + } }$ and $\mathrm { K } ^ { + }$ ions.  
$1 . 5 ~ \mathrm { \ p H }$ and conductivity measurem ents are also described.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 8.1  Procedure for Impurity Extrac tion (Part 1)
content:
Title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 8.1  Procedure for Impurity Extrac tion

Content: 8.1.1 Remove the protective film fro m the sample of tape. Cure the tape per tape manufacturer's recommendation, if necessary. 8.1.2 Cut the sample of tape so that it becomes smaller than $2 \mathrm { c m } \times 2 \mathrm { c m }$ . 8.1.3 Place $5 . 0 \pm 0 . 1$ grams of the ta pe sample into the Parr bomb, and add $5 0 \pm 0 . 5$ grams of deionized water. 8.1.3.1 In a second bomb, add deionized water only so that a blank solution may be obtained for measurement of the ionic contributed by the bomb. NOTE: It may be necessary to perform the blank test on both bombs in order to leach out excessive extractable ionic species. 8.1.4 Seal the caps and heat the bombs in an oven set at $1 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } \pm 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ , for $2 0 \pm 0 . 2 5$ hours. NOTE: The oven temperature may be set at $1 2 1 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } \pm 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ for 20 hours, if specified. 8.1.5 Allow the bombs to reach room temperature. 8.1.6 Open the bombs just before th e measurements are to

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 8.2  Quantitative Analysis by Ion Chromatography
content:
8.2.1  Prepare the chromatograph for operation by regenerating the columns according to the manufacturer’s recommendations.  
8.2.2  Run the eluent through the chr omatograph until a stable baseline calibration is established.  
8.2.3  Inject the recommended sampl e size of test solution into the chromatograph and record the ion chromatogram.  
8.2.4  Repeat for all the samples and also run the background sample.  
8.2.5  Determine the ionic type and c oncentration from the calibration curves.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 8.2.6  Results
content:
8.2.6.1  The concentration of ionic species in the leadframe tape is given by:  
$$
\mathbf { A } = \frac { ( \mathbf { B } - \mathbf { C } ) \times 5 0 } { 5 }
$$  
where :  
A is the ionic content of the leadframe tape (ppm)
B is the ionic content on the extracted solution, determined from the calibration curves (ppm)
C is the ionic concentration of the back - ground sample (ppm)

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 8.3  Quantitative Analysis by Flame Photometer or Atomic Absorption Spectrometer
content:
8.3.1  Set a specific operational cond ition for an apparatus.  
8.3.2  Introduce the recommended sa mple size of test solution into a flame.  
8.3.3  Repeat for all the samples and also introduce the background sample.  
8.3.4  Determine the concentration fr om calibration curves.  
8.3.5  Results  
8.3.5.1  The concentration of ionic species in the leadframe tape is given by:  
$$
\mathbf { A } = { \frac { ( \mathbf { B } - \mathbf { C } ) \times 5 0 } { 5 } }
$$  
where :  
A is the ionic content of the leadframe tape (ppm)
B is the ionic content on the extracted solution, determined from the calibration curves (ppm)
C is the ionic concentration of the back - ground sample (ppm)

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1  Summary of Method
content:
1.1  Two methods are described:  
1.1.1  Pull-Up Method — Using a ho ok attached to a tensile tester, the tape is pulled away from the leadframe inner leads.  
1.1.2  Push-Down Method — Using a probe attached to a tensile tester, a leadframe inner lead is pushed away from the tape.  
1.2  The adhesive strength between the lead and the tape should be measured at $2 3 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } \pm 5 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $2 5 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ .

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2  Equipment
content: 2.1  Tensile tester with appropriate load cell, clamping chucks, and a chart recorder. Tensile tester shall keep constant the traveling speed of clamping chucks, of which the traveling distance can be read to the nearest 1 mm, and shall simultaneously record the load imposed on the sample. It shall measure and record the imposed load with $\pm 1 \%$ on a chart recorder.

content:

content:

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6  Procedure
content:
Hot adhesive strength at $2 5 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ should be measured on the heater block with $6 0 \pm 1 0$ seconds.  
6.1  Pull-Up Procedure  
6.1.1  Set the tensile tester in the up-m ode, and adjust the rate to $1 0 0 \mathrm { m m } /$ minute.  
6.1.2  Place the leadframe under the clamp as shown in Figure 6.  
6.1.3  Position the hook under the tap e between the tie bar and its neighboring inner lead as shown in Figure 6. Similar leads and hook position shall be selected for other types of leadframes.  
6.1.4  Adjust the hook position until it just touches the tape and initiate the tensile tester in the up-mode. Record the strength to break the adhesion between the lead and the tape.  
6.1.5  Repeat the test for each leadfra me in the samples.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6.1.6  Calculation
content: 6.1.6.1  Discard the maximum and min imum values recorded, and average the remainder.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6.2  Push-Down Procedure
content:
6.2.1  Set the tensile tester in the down-mode, and adjust the rate to $1 0 0 \mathrm { m m }$ /minute.  
6.2.2  Place the leadframe on the tab le as shown in Figures 7 and 8.  
6.2.3  Position the probe at Point A o ver the selected inner lead as shown in Figure 9.  
6.2.4  Adjust the probe position until it just touches the inner lead and initiate the tensile tester in the down-mode.
Record the strength to break the adhesion between the inner lead and the tape.  
6.2.5  Repeat the test for each of the test positions noted in Section 6.2.4.  
6.2.6  Repeat the tests for each leadfr ame in the sample.  
6.3  Calculation  
6.3.1  Discard the maximum and min imum values recorded and average the remainder.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 7  Equipment Setup and Cal ibration
content: 7.1  Refer to the thermohygrostat m anufacturer’s manual for setup and calibration procedures.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 8  Procedure
content:
8.1  Separate off the protective film from the leadframe tape.  
8.2  Set the thermohygrostat at $2 3 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $50 \%$ RH and condition the samples at these conditions for 16 hours minimum.  
8.3  Weigh each sample to $0 . 1 ~ \mathrm { \ m g }$ accuracy $( \mathsf { W } _ { 1 }$ , Units-grams).  
8.4  Set the thermohygrostat at $8 5 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $8 5 \%$ RH and leave the samples at these conditions for $2 0 ~ \pm ~ 0 . 2 5$ hours.  
8.5  Wipe the water from sample su rface with lint-free clean wipes.  
8.6  Reweigh each sample ( $\mathbf { W } _ { 2 }$ , Un it-grams).

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 8.7  Calculation
content:
The water absorption obtained, A $( \% )$ , is deter-mined from the following equation:  
$$
{ \bf \cal A } ( \% ) = \frac { ( { \bf W } _ { 2 } - { \bf W } _ { 1 } ) \times 1 0 0 } { { \bf W } _ { 1 } }
$$

7.3  Remove the specimens from th e oven and store at $2 3 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } \pm 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $5 0 \pm 5 \%$ RH for 16 hours minimum.

{ \bf { A } } ( \% ) = \frac { ( { \bf { W } } _ { 1 } - { \bf { W } } _ { 2 } ) \times 1 0 0 } { { \bf { W } } _ { 1 } }
$$

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1  Summary of Method
content: 1.1  The length of tape samples is m easured before and after exposure to temperatures comparable to those used in the assembly and packaging of IC. The shrinkage is calculated as a percentage in the dimension measured.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2  Equipment
content:
2.1  Magnifying projector with $0 . 0 1 \ \mathrm { m m }$ accuracy
2.2 Circulating air oven capable o f $3 0 0 ~ \pm ~ 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$
accuracy
2.3  Cutting die for sample prepara tion
2.4  Thermohygrostat
2.5  Straight edge
2.6  Scribing tool

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 3  Sampling
content: 3.1  The sampling is one sample pe r one lot. The vendor must report the definition of lot, if the customer requires it.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Preparation of Specimens
content:
4.1  Cut specimens out of the samp les using the cutting die. The specimen shall be $1 0 0 \pm 1 . 0 \ \mathrm { m m }$ long and $1 0 \pm$ $1 . 0 \mathrm { m m }$ wide.  
4.2  Allow the specimen to be stab ilized at $2 3 ^ { \circ } \pm 2 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ and $5 0 \pm 5 \%$ RH for 16 hours minimum. This may be carried out in a climate controlled room or in a thermohygrostat.  
4.3  Using the straight edge and scr ibing tool, scribe marks on the specimens as shown in Figure 1. The marks shall be parallel to each edge of the specimen, and the distance to be measured, L, shall be parallel to the long side of the specimen. The mark shall be located within $5 \mathrm { m m }$ of the ends of the specimen.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5  Test Conditions
content:
5.1  Baking Condition $I - 1 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ for $6 0 \pm 1$ minute.  
5.2  Baking Condition 2 — $2 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ for $6 0 \pm 1$ minute.  
5.3  Baking Condition $3 \mathrm { ~ - ~ } 3 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ for $1 0 ~ \pm ~ 0 . 5$ minutes.  
NOTE: Alternate temperatures may be used by agreement between vendor and customer.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6  Procedure
content:
6.1  Place a specimen between the glass plates of the magnifying projector and measure the length, L1, between two marks (see Figure 1). Repeat this measurement for all specimens.  
6.2  Place the specimen in the oven at the appropriate test condition.  
6.3  Remove the specimens from th e oven and store at $2 3 ^ { \circ } \pm 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $5 0 \pm 5 \%$ RH for 16 hours minimum.  
6.4  Place the specimens between t he glass plates of the magnifying projector and measure the new length, $\mathbf { L } _ { 2 }$ , between two marks used in Section 6.1.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6.5  Calculation
content:
6.5.1 The shrinkage factor, A $( \% )$ , is determined from the following equation:  
$$
\mathrm { \bf ~ A } ( \% ) = \frac { ( \mathrm { \bf L } _ { \mathrm { \Theta _ { 1 } } } - \mathrm { \bf L } _ { \mathrm { \Theta _ { 2 } } } ) \times 1 0 0 } { \mathrm { \bf ~ L } _ { \mathrm { \Theta _ { 1 } } } }
$$  
where :  
L is the length (mm) of the specimen before baking
L  is the length (mm) of the specimen 2 after baking

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1  Summary of Method
content: 1.1  A thermogravimetric (TG) ana lyzer is used to monitor the weight of a tape sample as the temperature increases to $7 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ . It should be made to measure the leadframe tape or the base film and the adhesive separately. The results are obtained as a plot of Weight Retention versus Temperature, from which the thermal decomposition temperature for both the base film and the adhesive may be obtained.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2  Equipment
content:
2.1  Thermogravimetric (TG) analyzer capable of 0.01 mg accuracy.  
2.2  Thermohygrostat

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 3  Sampling
content: 3.1  The sampling is one sample pe r one lot. The vendor must report the definition of lot, if customer requires it.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Preparation of Specimens
content:
4.1  Allow the samples to be stabil ized at $2 3 \pm 5 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $5 0 ~ \pm ~ 5 \%$ RH for 16 hours minimum. This may be carried out in a climate controlled room or in a thermohygrostat.  
4.2  Cut specimens from the sampl e. The specimen shall weigh 10 to $2 0 \mathrm { m g }$ .  
NOTE 1: The base film before coating with the adhesive can be used for the test. The vendor has to ship the base film before coating with the adhesive, if customer requires it.  
NOTE 2: The adhesive sample can be obtained by scraping the adhesive.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5  Equipment Setup and Cal ibration
content:
5.1 Refer to Thermogravimetric A nalyzer manufacturer’s manual for setup and calibration procedures.  
5.2  The ambient in the measureme nt shall be air.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6  Procedure
content:
The measurement of TG should be made to measure the leadframe tape or the base film and the adhesive separately.  
6.1  Place the specimen in the plati num vessel.  
6.2  Set the thermal ramp to $1 0 ~ \pm ~ 1 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C } / \mathrm { \hbar }$ minute and maximum temperature to $7 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ .  
6.3  Repeat for all specimens.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 7  Method of Reading TG Cu rve
content: 7.1  In Figure 1, the thermal decom position is determined by the temperature at $5 \%$ of the weight loss.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1  Summary of Method
content: 1.1  A thermal mechanical analyze r is used to monitor the dimension of a tape sample with temperature increases to $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ . It can be made to measure the base film, adhesive, and the leadframe tape. The results are obtained as a plot of expansion versus temperature, from which Coefficient of Thermal Expansion (CTE) and Glass Transition Temperature $( \mathrm { T g } )$ may be obtained. CTE above the Tg cannot be measured because of softening and elongation of the sample.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2  Equipment
content:
2.1  Thermal mechanical analyzer (TMA) with chart recorder.  
2.2  Thermohygrostat
2.3  Cutting die for sample prepara tion
2.4  Calipers — 0.1 mm accuracy

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 3  Sampling
content: 3.1  The sampling is one sample pe r one lot. The vendor must report the definition of lot, if customer requires it.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Preparation of Specimens
content:
4.1  Cut specimens out of the samp les using the cutting die. The specimens shall be $2 0 \pm 0 . 1 \ \mathrm { m m }$ long and $5 . 0 \pm$ $0 . 1 \mathrm { m m }$ wide.  
4.2  Allow the samples to be stabil ized at $2 3 \pm 5 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $5 0 ~ \pm ~ 5 \%$ RH for 16 hours minimum. This may be carried out in a climate controlled room or in a thermohygrostat.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5  Equipment Setup and Cal ibration
content: 5.1  Refer to the thermal mechanic al analyzer manufacturer’s manual for setup and calibration procedures.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # Procedure
content:
6.1  Set the specimen to the chuck so that the length of the specimen under test is $1 0 \pm 0 . 1 \ \mathrm { m m }$ . Measure the specimen length using calipers.  
6.2  Attach the chuck to the TMA.  
6.3  Zero the recorder.  
6.4 Set the Thermal Ramp to $1 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } / $ minute, the maximum temperature to $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ , and the load to $2 . 0 \pm$ 0.2 grams.  
6.5  Initiate the test sequence and obtain a chart record of Elongation of the specimen versus Temperature (see Figure 1).  
6.6  Repeat for all specimens.  
6.7  Calculation of Results  
6.7.1 Coefficient of Thermal Expansion (k) — Calculate the CTE using the following equation:  
$$
k = \frac { \Delta \mathrm { L } } { \mathrm { L } \times \Delta \mathrm { T } }
$$  
where :  
L is the length (mm) of the specimen at room temperature. $\Delta \mathrm { L }$ is the elongation of the specimen (mm) for a given temperature difference, ∆ T $( ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } )$ . These values are taken from the chart as shown in Figure 1.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6.7.2  Glass Transition Temperature $( \mathrm { T g } )$
content:
6.7.2.1  On the chart, draw a best-fit tangent line to the curve between Point (A) and (B) and a second tangent between Point (C) and (D) (see Figure 1).  
6.7.2.2  Extend the lower tangent line above its highest temperature and the higher tangent line below its lowest temperature until they intersect. The temperature at the intersection point is the Glass Transition Temperature.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1 Purpose
content: 1.1  Tensile strength, elongation, a nd tensile modulus of leadframe tape are measured by a tensile pull tester, which is used to stretch the tape samples to the point of breakage with a calibrated load cell.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2  Equipment
content:
2.1  Tensile pull tester with $1 0 0 ~ \mathrm { k g }$ MAX load cell, sample clamping chucks, and a chart recorder.  
2.2  Micrometer with $0 . 0 0 1 \mathrm { ~ m m }$ ac curacy.  
2.3  Calipers with $0 . 0 2 \mathrm { m m }$ accurac y.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 3  Test Condition
content:
3.1  Tensile test measurements sha ll be carried out at the following ambient conditions:  
Temperature — $2 3 \pm 5 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ Humidity — $5 0 \pm 5 \%$ RH

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 4  Sampling
content:
4.1  The sampling is one sample pe r one lot. The vendor has to report the definition of lot, if the customer requires it.  
4.2  The sample width shall be $1 5 . 0 \pm 0 . 2 \mathrm { m m }$ , and the length must be $1 0 0 \mathrm { m m }$ minimum.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 5  Equipment Setup and Cal ibration
content:
5.1  Refer to the tensile tester manu facturer’s equipment manual for setup and calibration.  
5.2  The pulling rate shall be set to $5 \pm 0 . 5 \ \mathrm { m m } / \$ minute.  
5.3  The load shall be recorded in k ilograms.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6  Procedure
content:
6.1  Measure the thickness (T) of th e sample with the micrometer and the width (W) with calipers (mm).  
6.2  Clamp the tape in the chucks s o that the distance $( \mathrm { L } _ { 0 } )$ between the chucks is $5 0 \pm 5 ~ \mathrm { m m }$ .  
NOTE: Some equipment may measure this length automatically or plot Stress versus Strain, $\left( \mathrm { L } / \mathrm { L } _ { 0 } \right)$ , directly, where L is the elongation.  
6.3  Start the pulling and record un til the sample breaks.  
6.4  Repeat the testing procedures for all the samples.

content:

2.4  Humidity-controlled storage b ox

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 3  Sampling

content:
4.1  The specimen shall be punche d out from tape, the diameter of which has to be no less than that of the opposite electrode.  
4.2  Place the specimens in the con stant humidity box $2 3 ^ { \circ } \pm 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and $5 0 \pm 5 \%$ RH for $9 0 \pm 2$ hours. This may also be done after the electrodes are formed.

content:
6.1  Measure the thickness of speci men with the micrometer. Attach the electrodes to the specimen. Electrodes are formed by conductive epoxy printing or aluminum evaporation shown in Figure 1.  
NOTE 1: The electrodes shall be formed on both sides of the tape.  
NOTE 2: Suggested dimensions for the electrodes as shown in Table 1 $( { \bf d } _ { 1 } { - } { \bf d } _ { 2 } )$ should be at least 10 times the tape thickness.  
Table 1  Suggested Dimension of the Electrodes  
NOTE 3: At surface resistivity measurement, main electrode and guard electrode is attached to the adhesive surface.  
6.2  Place the specimens in the elec trode system as shown in Figure 2A.

content: 1.1  An increasing voltage is applie d between electrodes placed on both sides of the leadframe tape until breakdown, a large increase in current and voltage collapse, is observed.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6  Procedure
content: 6.1  Place the specimens on the dis k electrode and place the spherical electrode on the top of the tape. Ensure good contact between electrodes and tape.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 6.2  Setup Specimen
content:
6.2.1  Turn on the voltage supply and increase the voltage with constant ramp, until breakdown occurs.  
NOTE 1: Note the voltage at breakdown. In subsequent specimens, arrange the voltage ramp so that the breakdown occurs approximately within 10–20 seconds after the beginning of voltage application.  
6.3  Repeat the measurements for a ll the specimens.  
6.4  Measure the thickness of the s pecimens using the micrometer.

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 1. Purpose
content:
1.1 This standard addresses the adhesive demands of tape carrier packages (TCPs) and how reliability, versatility and cost may be optimized. The standardization of polyimide adhesive tape used in TCP is being promoted in order to meet these demands.  
5.1.1 Type of adhesive material
5.1.2 Type of base film
5.1.3 Width of adhesive material
5.1.4 Width of base film
5.1.5 Length of product

title: SEMI G74-0699SPECIFICATION FOR TAPE FRAME FOR 300 mm WAFERS - # 2. Scope
content: 2.1 This standard defines the standard for polyimidebased adhesive tapes (hereinafter " tape" ).
